Sentencas: Waste-to-energy (WTE) conversion technologies for generating renewable energy and solving the environmental problems have an important role in the development of sustainable circular economy.
Titulo: Process simulation development of a clean waste-to-energy conversion power plant: Thermodynamic and environmental assessment

Sentencas: This paper presents a novel high-efficiency WTE power plant using refuse-derived fuel (RDF) as feedstock by integrating torrefaction (T) pretreatment with plasma gasifier (PG), solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC), and combined heat and power (CHP) system.
Titulo: Process simulation development of a clean waste-to-energy conversion power plant: Thermodynamic and environmental assessment

Sentencas: The combined impacts of torrefaction conditions (i.e. temperature and residence time) and steam-to-fuel (S/F) ratio on the energy and environmental performances of the proposed T-PG-SOFC-CHP power plant without CO2 capture (System I) is first evaluated.
Titulo: Process simulation development of a clean waste-to-energy conversion power plant: Thermodynamic and environmental assessment

Sentencas: Results show that torrefaction of RDF prior to plasma gasification provides better syngas quality and therefore the system electrical efficiency (SEE) and CHP efficiency (CHPE) of System I can be markedly boosted compared to that of untreated RDF.
Titulo: Process simulation development of a clean waste-to-energy conversion power plant: Thermodynamic and environmental assessment

Sentencas: However, the integration of torrefaction unit shows a negative effect on the energy return on investment (EROI) due to high energy demands for torrefaction and plasma gasification.
